formalpara.title: Figure 2. Genetic pathway of programmed cell death in C. elegans
formalpara.para: Three phases of programmed cell death, specification, killing, and execution, are indicated. In the "specification" phase, genes involved in regulating the death fates of specific cells (HSNs and NSM sister cells) are shown. In the "execution" phase, two partially redundant pathways mediate the engulfment of cell corpses and the fragmentation of chromosomal DNA. nuc-1 and crn-6 may be involved in the degradation of DNA debris from apoptotic cells.
